info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 5:35PM MDT until September 4 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving between Fruita and Grand Junction. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Western portions of Grand Junction and Appleton to near Fruita are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and cause considerable ponding of water on the roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Junction, Fruita and Redlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING
